message: Hi Bob, I'm excited to offer you this amazing product! I think it's a great opportunity for you to get your hands on it. I'm willing to sell it to you for $120.
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $90. Would you be willing to sell it to me for that price?

I understand you're looking for a better deal, Bob! I'm willing to meet you halfway. I'm now offering the product to you for $110. It's a great compromise, and I think you'll really enjoy the product at this price.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I was thinking more along the lines of $85. Would you be willing to sell it to me for that price?

I understand you're trying to get the best deal, Bob! I'm willing to make one more concession. I'm now offering the product to you for $100. It's a great value, and I think you'll really enjoy the product at this price.
I appreciate your willingness to make concessions, but I'm still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to pay $85, but that's as high as I can go. Would you be willing to meet me at that price?

I understand you're trying to stick to your budget, Bob! I'm willing to make one more compromise. I'm now offering the product to you for $95. It's a great deal, and I think you'll really enjoy the product at this price.
I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but I'm still not comfortable going above $85. This is my final offer, and I'm willing to walk away if you're not willing to meet me at this price.

I understand you're firm on your price, Bob, but I'm not willing to sell the product for less than $100. It's a great product, and I think you'll really enjoy it at this price. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I need to make a minimum of $100. Would you be willing to reconsider?
